pages.text: I was given many chances, many warnings about exactly what would happen if I continued down the path of fossil fuel powered technology, but I ignored them, or maybe I felt powerless to prevent the inevitable. Now the warnings have become prophecies, and the prophecies have been proven correct.$(br2)The smog surrounding my factories is so thick and

suffocating that I need to wear a gas mask, otherwise I would choke on the toxic fumes. The oil reserves that seemed endless at first have started to dry up. My overproduction of plastic has lowered the price I can charge for them significantly.$(br2)I fear that the endless growth I felt promised to me was nothing more than a fantasy. I feel that time is running out to prevent a greater catastrophe, and I must search for a more sustainable path
